Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Scarab
Description: Pierced longitudinally to allow for its suspension, the recto of the object depicts the back of a scarab and the reverse a decorative motif in two sections. The surface of the lower register is filled with a series of regular circles. The upper register is filled with the motif of the unification of the two lands (sema-tawy).
